characters.quote: But if the path set before her feet was to be narrow she knew that flowers of quiet happiness would bloom along it.

characters.name: Curiosity
characters.quote: I'm clean puzzled, that's what, and I won't know a minute's peace of mind or conscience until I know what has taken Matthew Cuthbert out of Avonlea today.

characters.name: Community
characters.quote: she would never rest until she had ferreted out the whys and wherefores thereof.

characters.name: Tradition
characters.quote: not even a brook could run past Mrs. Rachel Lynde's door without due regard for decency and decorum;

characters.name: Isolation
characters.quote: It's just _staying_, that's what,
characters.explanation: Gray represents loneliness and detachment, highlighting the theme of seclusion.

characters.name: Cleanliness
characters.quote: Not a stray stick nor stone was to be seen, for Mrs. Rachel would have seen it if there had been.

characters.name: Friendship
characters.quote: Something that for lack of any other name might be called friendship existed and always had existed between Marilla Cuthbert and Mrs. Rachel, in spite of--or perhaps because of--their dissimilarity.
characters.explanation: This soft pink represents warmth and camaraderie, reflecting the bond between characters.

characters.name: Change
characters.quote: Well, the world was certainly turning upside down! She would be surprised at nothing after this!
characters.explanation: Orange symbolizes transformation and new beginnings, embodying the theme of change.

characters.name: Fear
characters.quote: You're bringing a strange child into your house and home and you don't know a single thing about him nor what his disposition is like nor what sort of parents he had nor how he's likely to turn out.

characters.name: Parental Responsibility
characters.quote: I could see that, so I gave in. It's so seldom Matthew sets his mind on anything that when he does I always feel it's my duty to give in.
characters.explanation: Steel blue represents the weight of responsibility and care.

characters.name: Risk And Consequence
characters.quote: Only don't say I didn't warn you if he burns Green Gables down or puts strychnine in the well.
characters.explanation: Magenta symbolizes the duality of risk and the potential outcomes.

characters.name: Compassion
characters.quote: My, but I pity him, that's what.

characters.name: Sensation Seeking
characters.quote: It would certainly make a sensation second to none, and Mrs. Rachel dearly loved to make a sensation.

characters.name: Doubt
characters.quote: somewhat to Marilla's relief, for the latter felt her doubts and fears reviving under the influence of Mrs. Rachel's pessimism.

characters.name: Nature
characters.quote: The air was sweet with the breath of many apple orchards and the meadows sloped away in the distance to horizon mists of pearl and purple.
characters.explanation: A fresh green symbolizes growth and the beauty of the natural world.

characters.name: Social Anxiety
characters.quote: Matthew dreaded all women except Marilla and Mrs. Rachel; he had an uncomfortable feeling that the mysterious creatures were secretly laughing at him.

characters.name: Unexpected Arrival
characters.quote: I'm not expecting a girl, said Matthew blankly. It's a boy I've come for.

characters.name: Imagination
characters.quote: I wouldn't be a bit afraid, and it would be lovely to sleep in a wild cherry-tree all white with bloom in the moonshine, don't you think?
characters.explanation: Light blue symbolizes creativity and freedom, embodying the essence of imaginative thoughts.

characters.name: Childhood
characters.quote: I do love to imagine I'm nice and plump, with dimples in my elbows.
characters.explanation: A warm peach color evokes nostalgia and innocence, capturing the essence of childhood.

characters.name: Misunderstanding
characters.quote: He could not tell this child with the glowing eyes that there had been a mistake; he would take her home and let Marilla do that.

characters.name: Belonging
characters.quote: Oh, it seems so wonderful that I'm going to live with you and belong to you.

characters.name: Hope
characters.quote: But I do hope that some day I shall have a white dress.
characters.explanation: Spring green symbolizes optimism and the belief in a better future.

characters.name: Acceptance
characters.quote: Yes, it's red... Now you see why I can't be perfectly happy. Nobody could who has red hair.

characters.name: Joy
characters.quote: Oh, it seems as if I must be in a dream. Do you know, my arm must be black and blue from the elbow up, for I've pinched myself so many times today.
characters.explanation: Yellow embodies happiness and positivity, reflecting the theme of joy.

characters.name: Anticipation
characters.quote: he felt glad that it would be Marilla and not he who would have to tell this waif of the world that the home she longed for was not to be hers after all.
characters.explanation: Hot pink symbolizes excitement and the thrill of looking forward.

characters.name: Rejection
characters.quote: You don't want me because I'm not a boy!

characters.name: Despair
characters.quote: Oh, what shall I do? I'm going to burst into tears!

characters.name: Food
characters.quote: When you try to eat a lump comes right up in your throat and you can't swallow anything, not even if it was a chocolate caramel.

characters.name: Inadequacy
characters.quote: I hate skimpy night-dresses. But one can dream just as well in them as in lovely trailing ones, with frills around the neck, that's one consolation.

characters.name: Judgment
characters.quote: I don't want an orphan girl and if I did she isn't the style I'd pick out.
characters.explanation: Bright orange-red signifies scrutiny and the critical nature of judgment.

characters.name: Beauty
characters.quote: Oh, wasn't it beautiful? Wasn't it a lovely place?
characters.explanation: Deep pink reflects the appreciation of beauty and aesthetics in life.

characters.name: Wonder
characters.quote: Oh, isn't it wonderful?

characters.name: Communication
characters.quote: For pity's sake hold your tongue.

characters.name: Sympathy
characters.quote: I kind of think she's one of the sort you can do anything with if you only get her to love you.

characters.name: Responsibility
characters.quote: This girl will have to be sent back to the asylum.

characters.name: Control
characters.quote: I'm going to drive over to White Sands and settle this thing.

characters.name: Positive Outlook
characters.quote: I've made up my mind to enjoy this drive.

characters.name: Self-acceptance
characters.quote: I can't even _imagine_ I'm sorry.

characters.name: Buried Hopes
characters.quote: 'My life is a perfect graveyard of buried hopes.'

characters.name: Romanticism
characters.quote: I am so fond of romantic things, and a graveyard full of buried hopes is about as romantic a thing as one can imagine.
characters.explanation: Light pink reflects the idealism and emotional depth of romanticism.

characters.name: Nostalgia
characters.quote: Avonlea is a lovely name. It just sounds like music.
characters.explanation: Gold represents cherished memories and the warmth of the past.

characters.name: Loneliness
characters.quote: It seems to be my fate. Father and mother had both come from places far away and it was well known they hadn't any relatives living.

characters.name: Abandonment
characters.quote: But they had to take me and I was there four months until Mrs. Spencer came.

characters.name: Education
characters.quote: I can read pretty well and I know ever so many pieces of poetry off by heart--'The Battle of Hohenlinden' and 'Edinburgh after Flodden,' and 'Bingen of the Rhine.'

characters.name: Poetry
characters.quote: Don't you just love poetry that gives you a crinkly feeling up and down your back?

characters.name: Empathy
characters.quote: Oh, they _meant_ to be--I know they meant to be just as good and kind as possible.

characters.name: Parenthood
characters.quote: It must be very trying to have twins three times in succession, don't you think?

characters.name: Social Expectations
characters.quote: When people mean to be good to you, you don't mind very much when they're not quite--always.

characters.name: Freedom
characters.quote: Don't you think it would be nice to wake up at sunrise and swoop down over the water...

characters.name: Reluctance
characters.quote: Marilla did not look as if she thought Providence had much to do with the matter.

characters.name: Adoption
characters.quote: I feel that I oughtn't to decide on anything without consulting him.

characters.name: Maternal Instinct
characters.quote: I could not take the responsibility of doing that!

locations.name: Lynde's Hollow
locations.quote: MRS. Rachel Lynde lived just where the Avonlea main road dipped down into a little hollow, fringed with alders and ladies' eardrops and traversed by a brook that had its source away back in the woods of the old Cuthbert place.

locations.name: Green Gables
locations.quote: The big, rambling, orchard-embowered house where the Cuthberts lived was a scant quarter of a mile up the road from Lynde's Hollow.

locations.name: Avonlea
locations.quote: Avonlea occupied a little triangular peninsula jutting out into the Gulf of St. Lawrence with water on two sides of it.

locations.name: Bright River
locations.quote: Matthew Cuthbert and the sorrel mare jogged comfortably over the eight miles to Bright River.

locations.name: Prince Edward Island
locations.quote: It isn't as if we were getting him from England or the States. He can't be much different from ourselves.

locations.name: Avenue Of Apple Trees
locations.quote: The "Avenue," so called by the Newbridge people, was a stretch of road four or five hundred yards long, completely arched over with huge, wide-spreading apple-trees.

locations.name: Child's Emotional Outburst
locations.quote: You don't want me because I'm not a boy! I might have expected it. Nobody ever did want me.

locations.quote: Will you please call me Cordelia? It's such a perfectly elegant name.

locations.name: Marilla's Home
locations.quote: Marilla had been wondering where Anne should be put to bed.

locations.name: Anne's Childhood Memories

locations.quote: Anne navigates her feelings about new dresses and church etiquette while facing judgment from peers during Sunday school.

locations.name: Barry Garden
locations.quote: Mrs. Rachel would have liked to stay until Matthew came home with his imported orphan.

locations.quote: The bridge spanned it midway and from there to its lower end, where an amber-hued belt of sand-hills shut it in from the dark blue gulf beyond.

locations.name: Across The Brook
